Description: Flow cytometry is well established as a technology that excels in exploratory studies due to its flexibility and utility in analyzing multiple cell types and markers. Recent innovations, and the advent of spectral flow, have led to ever more complex assays. This has led to an increased interest in using flow cytometry for non-exploratory assays such as pharmacokinetics and receptor occupancy analysis. These assays, however, can be more challenging to develop and run effectively. This presentation will discuss how to overcome these challenges, and deliver key insights on how to maximize the value of flow cytometry in a clinical setting.
SearchResultBody: ESP04E. Moving From Exploratory to Clinical Flow Cytometry Assays: Overcoming Challenges to PK and RO in a Clinical Setting
Title: Moving From Exploratory to Clinical Flow Cytometry Assays: Overcoming Challenges to PK and RO in a Clinical Setting
